Muchas gracias.

title: How to best organise tabs without keeping windows/tabs open all the time
content:
Let's say I have 20 windows open, each with 30 tabs on. Instead of these windows consuming resources and sitting open, I want a really, really easy way of "saving" each window as is (as they're organised by topic), closing them, and then by hitting just a couple of buttons voila, I can see all the potential windows, select what I need and have it open, and easy to shut again in reverse.

How can I do this? I can't make head nor tail of Firefox bookmarks - have examined the menu option, have read the articles, still as clear as mud. For example, "save all tabs" doesn't seem to mean save all tabs, it just means save tabs in the window you've maximised. Then after creating its own folder in Bookmark menu, when I added a new tab to it I thought that would update. It doesn't. Then I manually did another "save all tabs" for that menu - and the new tab didn't appear.

I don't even know if Bookmarks is the way to even attempt what I'm trying to do here in my question. Does anyone have any great tips on how to minimise the firefox window clutter, but have it really accessible easily?

Thanks.
creator: l569

title: Hudl.com data entry, "-" symbol
content:
hudl.com is a website that American Football teams use for storing and breaking down game film. Data entry is an essential feature of the website. One column of data that is entered is "yard line". This point marks where the ball is down at the end of one play, and at the beginning of the next. Whenever the ball is inside a teams own territory, hudl.com has users enter the yardline with a negative symbol, e.g., -20. There are -1 to -49 yard lines and positive 1 to 50. The problem I am having on Firefox only is with the negative "-" symbol. I cannot enter it into cells; if you hit the button with that cell active nothing happens. My solution for this is switching to a competing browser. I have consulted with hudl.com as well, and their only help offered was to switch browsers. Switching browsers work, but it interrupts my workflow, and I'd like to do most everything in Firefox.

I am on Mac OS. This problem has occurred across many versions and updates. It also occurs on any Windows computer I have used. Using Chrome is my normal remedy.
creator: rwhitenack

content:
non riesco più ad utilizzare l'estensione keepa:

Oh no! Initialization Failed

Checking your connection to Keepa:  OK! Checking WebSocket connectivity:  Failed with status 1006 Connection headers: No proxy issue identified.


Please check if there is an update available for your browser. It is possible that your connection to Keepa is interrupted by browser extensions, proxys or firewalls you or your company use. You can try to use a private/incognito browser session, use another browser or your mobile device to verify if that is the case. Certain anti-virus software (like Kaspersky, avast!, NOD32) features (usually called something like "web security") can prevent Keepa from working as well - try disabling them to see if that is the case.

If the error persists, please open your browser console (F12 > Console) to look for any 'WebSocket' errors logged and send us a snapshot of them to info@keepa.com.

creator: carlo.sorosina

title: Picture-in-picture keyboard controls not working properly
content:
As far as I know there are quite a few keyboard shortcuts one can use in picture-in-picture mode. However, they don't always work for me. Most notably, spacebar often toggles the last thing I clicked in picture-in-picture mode. For example, I enter full screen mode and press spacebar to play the video, but instead it exits the full screen. Or I click on one of the "rewind" buttons, after which spacebar adopts the function of that button until I manually click play. For some reason, the arrow keys also don't always work. I suspect it's the problem of the same origin.

I also feel the need to say that this behavior is not limited to picture-in-picture. This is similar to what happens in almost all video players online and, possibly, some of the offline ones as well. I have also checked a few forums (VLC development thread and Stack Overflow) and it seems to be a common issue across many video players.

Still, if anyone knows any way to deal with this problem in Firefox picture-in-picture as a user, I would greatly appreciate it, as it interferes with multitasking a lot more than on any other players.

title: Unsynced Devices Belonging To Other Household Members Opening Tabs On My Computer
content: Hi, I have been wanting to switch to Firefox for a while now and I have imported all of my data from Chrome onto Firefox. All the other members of my household use Firefox on their Mac laptops and iPhones. I have only ever signed into my own account on Firefox, and in the same way I have only ever signed into my own account on Mozilla VPN, which I have used for over a year while living elsewhere and have never had a problem with this. I also have only my own Google account in the data imported from Chrome. I have no one else's information for any account on anything in my device nor, to my knowledge, do they have any account information of mine on theirs. However, sometime in the 10 or so months since I imported my Chrome data - around the same time I moved into a house with others who use Firefox - my laptop's Firefox seems to have...connected somehow, in a way atypical with normal syncing, with the other devices in my house. Occasionally, when I open Firefox on my computer, whatever tab another household member has open on their computer will open instead of a homepage. Also, a little icon pops up occasionally to tell me Firefox is "open on iPhone" when another household member is using Firefox on their iPhone. I use an Android which does not have Firefox installed, so it's not a glitch syncing with my own device. I do not know how this happened and I do not know how to stop it. There doesn't seem to be any evidence of this connection in any place I can see in the preferences window, nor can I find any way to permanently unsync my device's Firefox application from anything unless I sync something first. Any ideas? I'm not that terrible with computers lol, I swear!
creator: catluv321

title: switch between tabs by clicking
content:
I used to have the Tab Mix Plus extension which no longer works in Firefox.

The one feature I really miss from this extension is the ability to alternate between 2 tabs by clicking on one of them. I know that there are various extensions that allow you to switch tabs using shortcut keys and I do use the Switch to Previous Active Tab extension which is useful but I do miss the simplicity of being able to just click on a tab to switch to the previous and even after several years without it I still often try to do it, forgetting that it no longer works.

Is there any extension or setting that can reinstate this feature?

title: Not all passwords importing
content:
Hello all,

I've recently switched back from Chrome to Firefox, imported all passwords, bookmarks etc and off I go...

Only, I'm coming across more and more websites (about four so far) that don't have their logins transferred. The most recent and big one being Twitter, where there are two accounts saved on Chrome, but Firefox says it has none. I've tried all the usual, restarting both browsers and PC, checking there's no security I can find that locks those down (if there is I cannot find it) and the like. I'm on Windows 10 Pro, fully updated with latest patches on all browsers and Win10 itself.

Is this a security thing from those specific sites? Could it be a drastic change to the address fooling Firefox (and if so, why if I go back to Chrome do they load in fine?) or something I'm just not thinking of? I'm really hoping I don't have to keep going back to Chrome randomly to find a password when Firefox finds one it doesn't remember, kind of destroys the purpose of moving away from Google...

Thanks in advance!

title: Cant Past text into FireFox adresss bar or websites.
content:
I recently started encountering issues with Firefox where i cant past text.

As an example, i can copy the text in this text field here, and past it into notepad, or Edge. But i cant past it into the address bar on Firefox, or here in this textbox (Cant Past any text into Firefox).

The text is being copied, as i can past it into other applications with no issues. Refreshing Firefox has not fixed or affected the issue.

Running Firefox on troubleshoot mode has not had any effect.

The issue appears to start occurring after Windows 11 goes to sleep, and is then woken up, to resume. Restarting the computer fixes the issue. (Note that terminating the Firefox process and starting it again does not fix the issue).

title: How to display last 4 digits of credit card number next to expiry date
content:
Hello,

If you have a few card numbers stored, this gets really annoying because there's no way to tell which expiry date corresponds to the credit card number that you filled in previously. Is there a way for Firefox to display the last 4 digits of the card number next to the expiry dates?

I've attached a screenshot to illustrate the issue.

Many thanks!
